How do I use the `getcurrencytrust` command to get a list of all available currencies?

The `getcurrencytrust` command doesn't actually return a list of all available currencies. Instead, it returns a JSON object with rating values for specified currencies, or all currencies if no specific ones are specified. To get all currency ratings, you would simply call the command without specifying any currencies, like this: `verus getcurrencytrust`.

getcurrencytrust '["currencyid",...]'

Arguments
"["currencyid",...]"                    (strarray, optional) if specified, only returns rating values for specified currencies, otherwise all

Result:
{
 "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...},    (jsonobj) an ID/ratings key/value object
 "currencytrustmode":<n>              (int) 0 = no restriction on sync, 1 = only sync to IDs rated approved, 2 = sync to all IDs but those on block list
}

Examples:
> verus getcurrencytrust '["currencyid",...]'
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getcurrencytrust", "params": ['["currencyid",...]'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
What is the purpose of the `currencytrustmode` parameter in the `getcurrencytrust` command?

There is no `currencytrustmode` parameter in the `getcurrencytrust` command. The `currencytrustmode` is actually part of the result returned by the command, and it's an integer value indicating the currency trust mode: 0 for no restriction on sync, 1 for syncing only to IDs rated approved, and 2 for syncing to all IDs except those on the block list.

getcurrencytrust '["currencyid",...]'

Arguments
"["currencyid",...]"                    (strarray, optional) if specified, only returns rating values for specified currencies, otherwise all

Result:
{
 "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...},    (jsonobj) an ID/ratings key/value object
 "currencytrustmode":<n>              (int) 0 = no restriction on sync, 1 = only sync to IDs rated approved, 2 = sync to all IDs but those on block list
}

Examples:
> verus getcurrencytrust '["currencyid",...]'
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getcurrencytrust", "params": ['["currencyid",...]'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
Can I use the `getcurrencytrust` command to set the trust mode for a specific currency?

No, the `getcurrencytrust` command is used to retrieve the current trust mode and ratings for one or more currencies, not to set the trust mode. It does not have any parameters to set or modify the trust mode.

getcurrencytrust '["currencyid",...]'

Arguments
"["currencyid",...]"                    (strarray, optional) if specified, only returns rating values for specified currencies, otherwise all

Result:
{
 "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...},    (jsonobj) an ID/ratings key/value object
 "currencytrustmode":<n>              (int) 0 = no restriction on sync, 1 = only sync to IDs rated approved, 2 = sync to all IDs but those on block list
}

Examples:
> verus getcurrencytrust '["currencyid",...]'
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getcurrencytrust", "params": ['["currencyid",...]'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
